plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: A large evergreen shrub native to western Asia and southeast Europe, thriving in temperate climates. It produces clusters of trumpet-shaped flowers that can range from purple to white.
plants.location: Temperate forests of Europe and western Asia
plants.funFact: Rhododendrons can have toxic nectar that affects some pollinators, making their ecology fascinating.

plants.name: Lilium auratum
plants.description: This strikingly beautiful lily species is native to Japan and bears large white flowers with gold stripes and a sweet fragrance. It blooms in late spring to early summer.
plants.funFact: Lilium auratum is highly prized in Japanese gardens and can grow up to 2 meters tall.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree known for its fern-like leaves and spectacular, bright orange-red flowers that attract birds and insects.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not related to oak trees; its timber is valued for furniture making.

plants.name: Mimulus guttatus
plants.description: A wildflower commonly found near streams and moist environments in western North America. It has yellow, spotted flowers that attract a variety of pollinators.
plants.funFact: The flowers of Mimulus guttatus are known for their diverse pollination strategies involving both bees and hummingbirds.
